Posts.Title: Sad News!

Posts.Content: Very nicely said.
Posts.Title: Thanking the Katies of the world.

Posts.Content: I had a needle biopsy in 2005 and it hurt like hell. I can't remember if it was sore afterwards because I they surgically went in to take out the lump. I'm currently taking gabapentin for neuropathy, not why sure why they gave you that. It's supposed to be more for nerve pain. I hope by now you are better. If not, you should call the doctor again or see a different one.
Posts.Title: pain after needle biopsy

Posts.Content:
I have been on it since 1/06. I experienced a lot of hot flashes for about
 a year, but it seems to have pretty much gone away. I get one once in a while. My eyebrows still haven't grown back and the hair on my head grew back very thin and straight. I hate it! My hair used to be thick and wavy. I'm hoping once I get of this med my hair might come back to normal. I also go thru periods where the hair on my legs doesn't grow very fast.
Posts.Title: Tamoxifen Side Effects

Posts.Content: I gained weight period... I was on weight watchers during Tamoxifen. I have been. I got tired of dieting and gained almost all my weight back. Mine wasn't due to the drug. I don't think you will drop the weight just like that without trying. Sorry. I have to diet again. I have high cholesterol and I am now diabetic (don't have to take meds YET) I am going to start some kind of regimen. I hate that I gained almost all my weight back.
Posts.Title: tamoxifen

Posts.Content: I lost mine during chemo and they never came back. I was on Tamoxifen for 5 years. I have been on Armidex for a year and they still haven't come back. I hate it! I have to pencil in brows and then I can't make them look the same all the time.
Posts.Title: tamoxifen

Posts.Content:
I still stop by and read posts. But I'm back with my own sad news. I have been diagnosed with Mantle cell lymphoma. Just got out of the hospital yesterday. This is not something I wanted to hear after just turning 55. I seemed to survive the breast cancer and this just creeped up all of a sudden. Looks like my regular oncologist will be able to treat me instead of traveling about
 45 minutes. Every other treatment will require me to do a hospital stay. So my new journey begins today.
Posts.Title: It's been a long time

Posts.Content: Congrats on being a survivor!
Posts.Title: 17 years ago today, I was diagnosed with breast cancer...

Posts.Content: I became a 6 year survivor on 12/29/11.
Posts.Title: 17 years ago today, I was diagnosed with breast cancer...

Posts.Content:
I get my prescript
ion filled automatically every month from Kmart. So I go to pick it up this evening and it was only $16 & change. I have been paying $45.45 since April. I wasn't going to say anything but did in case they gave me the wrong meds. SO she said no this is right, it's the generic for (she couldn't think of the name) so I said Femera. She said no it's starts with an "A". I said Arimidex? she said yeah. I said I thought I was taking generic Femera. So since April I thought I was taking Femera. As far as the price goes, I guess it went down which is fine by me.
Talk about
 chemo brain.
Posts.Title: Boy, am I a crackhead

Posts.Content: What is the latest on Jo Ann? This topic is the last one I see.
Posts.Title: Jo-Ann news

Posts.Content:
I have been good. Still cancer free after almost 6 years. I know I don't come over here much. I try to forget I ever had this disease. But I am reminded of it every morning getting ready for work when I have to draw on eyebrows. My eyebrow hair never came back. I have a few but you can't even see them. I have been on generic Femara since April. I seem to be doing ok with it it just costs more than tamoxifen.
I come and lurk from time to time to see how people are doing.
Posts.Title: Jo-Ann news

Posts.Content:
I did a little research to see if the arimidex can cause trigger finger, because I ended up with it in my thumb about
 a month after I started taking it.
Posts.Title: Boy, am I a crackhead

Posts.Content:
I found out mine developed before I started taking Arimidex. Mine is in my left thumb, I am right handed. Just recently too (left hand also) my thumb, 1st & middle finger have more of a tingling sensation. I never got rid of the neuropathy in my fingers & toes after chemo because I smoke. But it is not as bad as it was while and right after I finished chemo. I did get a shot in my thumb back when the trigger finger was going on, but it only lasted about
 4 months. That was one of the most painfullest shots I have ever gotten.
Posts.Title: Boy, am I a crackhead

Posts.Content: Ok, so now that I have found out I'm on Arimidex instead of Femera..... anyone here on it? What if any side effects have you had? In the last couple of weeks my first 2 fingers have gotten more tingly. I have trigger finger in my left thumb but that developed before I started taken the meds.
Posts.Title: Arimidex

Posts.Content: How is your brother doing?
Posts.Title: Sorry I've been out of touch...

Posts.Content: I jusy got off of it 2 months ago after 5 years. I didn't have any kind of side effects.
Posts.Title: Tomaxifen as continuing treatment
Hello everyone

Posts.Content: I haven't been here in a long time. I stopped the Tamoxifen in February and just started generic Femara 2 weeks ago. I didn't have any side effects with the Tamoxifen other than the hair on my legs and armpits would sometimes grow really really slow, other times it grew normally.
Posts.Title: Femara - anyone on it? Been on it?

Posts.Content:
Bernadette, I know what you mean about
 being independent, I'm the same way. You did your chemo on Thursday and got the shot on Friday? If so, when did you feel the effects of the shot? My treatment will be on Thursday and will be getting my shot on Friday. I'm wondering what time of the day should I get it. I know things work differently on people, but I don't want to get it in the morning then become sick while I'm at work and can't drive myself home. You didn't scare me with your post, it just added to the anxiety I'm already having about
 all this. No... I am very glad to get this info so I know what I could possibly expect. All the info the ladies give is helpful to me right now. I wish I could be more helpful to others. Maybe later on after I've gone through all this. Thanks and lots of hugs to everyone.

Nulasta shot!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!
Nulasta shot!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

Posts.Content: I didn't have any problems with the shot. I felt a little achy, but nothing to drag me down.
Posts.Title: Nulasta shot!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

Nulasta shot!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

Posts.Content:
Holy crap! I wonder if this is the same shot I will be getting the day after too? All I remember them saying was something about
 bone marrow as to why I need the shot. My 1st treatment is on a Thursday. If this is the same shot, should I get this on my way home from work, provided I may it to work the day after chemo? So if it takes about
 a week to kick in, are you in pain that whole time? Well, not necessarily pain, but pretty uncomfortable? Oh, gosh, I am so not looking forward to this.

 inflammatory breast cancer and how a lot of women are just given anitbiotics for it and it doesn't get better, then they get it further examined.
Posts.Title: Red spot on breast

Posts.Content: I've never had a problem with high blood pressure. I am close to becoming diabetic and have high cholesterol. I am taking Tricor for the cholesterol. I'm getting blood work done next weeek again and will then make an appointment with my family doc. My calves still swell too. But this all started last year after starting chemo, so I am blaming it on that.  Thanks for your response.

Posts.Content:
Happy Happy Joy Joy! People like you give us lots of hope. I've had 2 mammo's since my surgeries last summer and they have been normal. That's an accomplishment for me. I'm working on getting the cholesterol down. Mine is about
 twice as high as yours is.

Posts.Content: Is this the one that helps with osteoperosis (sp?) If so, I called my Onc's office the other day when I heard bout it and she said it hasn't been approved yet for breast cancer and that it is only a preventative to those that are at high risk of getting the disease, not for ones who already have it. Which didn't make a lot of sense since it's supposed to be better than tamoxofin as far as side effects goes.

Feeling down

Posts.Content: I seemed to have my brows and lashes until recently I noticed I only had a few hairs for brows. I've been penciling them in which I have NEVER had to do, and my lashes seemed to have thinned out also, especially the bottom ones. My last chemo was on 12/29. My head just feels like sandpaper which it did before I did my last chemo. I hate to think of wearing this wig all summer because I refuse to even walk around with just 2 inches of hair!

Posts.Content:
Sorry you're having to go thru this. Hopefully 2006 will be better for all of us. I can kind of imagine how you are feeling about
 being the next one. I can't help think that myself for me. It's like, what happens now that I'm done, constantly worry that it may come back? Everyone here has been so kind and helpful and supportive.
Posts.Title: Handling the "What if's"

Posts.Content: I'm late too, but Happy New Year to everyone and may it be the best for all of us!

Posts.Title: Last go round
Last go round

Posts.Content: Hope everyone had a wonderful Christmas. Let's hope that 2006 will be healthier year for all of us. You all are a great bunch.
Posts.Title: Merry Christmas

Posts.Content: You are right to be angry. I hate to see what medicaid is going to be like when I become of age to get it. I hate to think of people who don't have any kind of insurance. I guess they just have to die. I was so surprised when I went to the ER today that someone from the Admin office came in there to get my ins card and ID then came back and asked for the copay of $50. I've always been billed in the past. I should have asked him what if I didn't have it to pay right then. Would they throw me out and not bill me?
Posts.Title: Anyone else tired of fighting?
Swelling?Numbness?

Posts.Content:
Well, the dreaded happened for me today. A 
 of my hair fell out this morning. I thought I was going to be able to handle it, but I cried and it took all I had not to cry at work today and on top of that, a nice coworker was leaving today so we couldn't even hug goodbye because she was emotional and she knew I was having a bad day. I got my wig, but come to find out my ins won't pay for it because I didnt go to a participating memeber, which no one 
 told me they had some!!! 
 I can send it back but now I have to run to a place that's about
 50 miles from me on Saturday to see one she ordered for me in a color that may be close to mine. I have talked to my ins co several times about
 this issue and they always tell me something different. I finally got some straight answers after 2 months! 
 How can I have positive thoughts each day when I keep getting kicked down by something. Sorry to be so negative, but I'm really down right now and just needed to vent.
Posts.Title: Hair loss

Posts.Content:
Thanks for your input. I'm going to attempt to go to the ER this morning. We had a little snow yesterday and my streets are kind of icy around here. My right ankle isn't quite as swollen this morning. I elevated it more than normal last night while I was watching TV. My ankle had swelled some about
 a month ago now, but it went away and I never thought anything of it. But it's been a few days now. I do have some pain in that ankle once in a while like arthritis. I think I sprained that ankle when I was a teenager.
Posts.Title: Swelling?Numbness?

Posts.Content: I actually saw a site that sells real hair eyebrows, but there was no other info, and when I called some dumb man said he didn't know how they get put on and if they come with some kind of adhesive. They were cheap too, like $3 for a pair.
Posts.Title: Hair loss

Posts.Content:
The nursse told me about
 14 days my hair should start to come out 
 .There was a lady there getting her 4th treatment and she was bald but she didn't lose her eybrows, eyelashes or arm hair. I don't know what kind of cocktail she's getting, but I would like not to lose those hairs.
Posts.Title: Hair loss

Posts.Content:
Donna, did you get a human hair wig? Because I thought you could only due things to human hair wigs that you can do to your own hair. That was one of the first things I asked at this place I went to, if I could color it and they said only if it's all human. The one I ordered is part human and fiber and I won't be able to use real products on it. 
 I may call tomorow to make sure they did order my wig. I already got my meds filled and will take them with me on Thursday so they can tell me what to take when. I can't even remember to take a vitamin once a day (which reminds me, I need to take one now) I don't know how I'm going to keep up with taking what I have. I have 3 diff meds right now. I hope they will work and I won't have to get something else filled. Of all things I just came back from vac yesterday and last week while away part of my tooth broke off. One that is more filling than tooth. I knew this tooth would have to be crowned eventually. I went to the dentist today and told him about
 my cancer and treatments starting this week and if there was any way possible he can do something temporary. Well, he was able to do it but said any kind of sensitivity or anything to let him know right away. Gosh I hope I don't have to try to have a root canal and crown while I'm doing chemo.
Posts.Title: Hair loss
Hair loss

Posts.Content: By the way, anyone have any suggestions on lotion(s) to use on your head for moisturizing I guess. All I have in my house is perfumed type lotions, would they suffice?
Posts.Title: Hair loss

Posts.Content: Bern, I just found out when last week when I went to the Onc for followup from my rads that I still have stitches under my breast from my surgery on 7/27!!!! I remember seeing a fishing line like thing after my surgery but thought it would disolve. I'm going tomorrow to have them taken it out. Geesh! I DO NOT REMEMBER THEM TELLING ME TO COME BACK AFTER MY RADS!!! I'm glad you're starting to handle the no hair thing. I keep looking everyday for signs or more hair than normal coming out and it's only been 4 days since my 1st treatemtn.
Posts.Title: Hair loss
Hair loss

Posts.Content:
Sorry for your loss. My mom is still alive and sometimes I cry thinking about
 the day she won't be around anymore. She's not sick or anything so hopefully she will just die of old age. My dad passed away in '97 he was 79. I don't have any brothers or sisters. What relatives I have live in Europe and I only know my uncle and his wife and only met them twice because they came here. So once my mom is gone I feel like I will have no one. I'm sorry you didn't get to have your mom made up like you wanted. Hang in there and lots of {{hugs}} to you. :)
Posts.Title: breast cancer
No more cocktails of either type

Posts.Content: I haven't lost mine (I have had 3 chemos). My bottom ones may have thinned out just a little. How many treatments have you had?
Posts.Title: Losing eyelashes again

Posts.Content: I just give up at this point. Nothing is working in my favor. This place that is so far away says she has a lot of wigs and she ordered one for me that hopefully will be the color close to mine and it will be there when I get there tomorrow. I think next time my job changes insurances I will go with the more expensive plan so I can go out of network.
Posts.Title: Hair loss
Hair loss

Posts.Content:
Bernadette, I'm sorry you are feeling so crappy a lot. I have been doing pretty well on my regimen. I feel a little crappy for the 1st week. I get my chemo on Thursdays and usually end of taking off on Friday, sometimes Monday. I wish I could afford to just take the whole week off. As it is, this is such a financial strain on me. I am eating less healthy because I'm just cramming whatever in my mouth just to get that nasty feeling out of there. I end up gaining about
 3-6 pounds, but then it usually comes off by the time I go for the next one. Oh, and I have been loving watermelon since chemo. I guess the wetness of it satisfies the inside of my mouth.
Posts.Title: Hair loss

Posts.Content:
Bern I was wondering how your bronchitis was. Please take care. I'm lucky with my docs 
locations. I live 7 miles from work and all my docs are in between my home and job, so I can do a doc appointment during my lunch if need be. At this point in y life, I couldn't deal with the stress with having to drive almost an hour for an appointment.
Posts.Title: Hair loss

Posts.Content: So I went to the ER this morning and no blood clots. The ER doc called my Onc (not sure for what) but I'm just retaining fluid. She told him she was going to add more steriods to my regimen???? Anyway, the paper they gave me with what they think it is said to eat a light salt diet. I know for the last week I have been eating a lot of crap, McDonald's, Dominoes. So I guess I"ll live a little while longer.
Posts.Title: Swelling?Numbness?
Hair loss

Posts.Content: I had follow up today with my Onc and she said I am doing the Taxotere instead of Taxol. She said with the Taxol you do more treatments??? But I don't think it has been proven if one os better than the other. I only have to do 6 chemos and I think she said with Taxol you do 8??? I guess those doing Taxol can comment on this.
Posts.Title: Hair loss

Posts.Content: Bernadette,
Posts.Title: Hair loss

Posts.Content: Congratulations! I wish you a lot of happiness.
Posts.Title: Chapters ending and starting....

Posts.Content: That does seem kind of rude even though she said it in a nice way. I REFUSE to leave the house without my wig. At home I just wear cotton like head coverings. But at work for those who don't know I feel like they may be wonerding if I'm wearing a wig because I went from long to short hair which was pretty dramatic.  I'm always kind of pulling at the sides by my ears to keep from seeing that I have no lind of sideburns. I can actually feel a little nubble on my head, so I think it is slowly coming back.
Posts.Title: So I'm in the grocery store...

Posts.Content: A little late but Happy Birthday!
Posts.Title: We need a drum for lemonz' birthday!

Posts.Content:
Hopefully my wig will be here by then. That's if it starts coming out about
 2 weeks after my first treatment. That will be about
 5 weeks. I should call them just to check on the status of my order. I'm not a hat or scarf person. And if I started wearing those things to work people would wonder why. Only a few select people in my office know. I work in a small office where there is always drama and office politics going on. I just feel funny about
 the whole thing. And I get so many compliments on my hair color. I dye it due to greying 
 It's kind of a burgundy color. I had a lady over the weekend tell me how she was admiring the color as the sun was hitting it before I walked in the store and I wanted to cry. That has been my biggest dilmea with wigs. Finding a color close to this and a style. I sent away for a color ring thru a website that has the wig I want and I found a color a little close, that's why they had to special order it because they said no one has ever bought that color before. I guess most people get wigs in the basic colors.
Posts.Title: Hair loss

Posts.Content: Ha Ha! That's great! Good luck with the checkup. Hope it will all be possitive.
Posts.Title: mammo and onc monday

Posts.Content: Congrats on your last AC. Sorry it's been rough for you. It has been rough for me to.
Posts.Title: No More Red Devil!!

Posts.Content: I'm late on this, but hope everyone had a good Thanksgiving. I ordered one of the cooked meals from my grocery store. It had everything. I had chemo the week before and knew I wouldn't feel like cooking that day. It was good too. I ate, but it just kind of tasted like crap.
Posts.Title: Happy Thanksgiving

Posts.Content: Happy Holidays to everyone here. This is a nice group of people here (even though I don't come here a whole lot) with lots of advice and experiences that have helped me in one way or another. My last treatment will be next Thursday and I can't wait.
Posts.Title: Happy Holidays!!

Posts.Content: When I went to the surgeon's office last month, she told me she had a lot of women in her office this year in their 30's with breast cancer.
Posts.Title: Breast Cancer in women under 40...m
2 more to go
Hair loss
Chantry & Kattbird

Posts.Content: I have nubs on my head. My last chemo will be 12/29, hopefully it will be all uphill from there. I never shaved my head either. I still won't look at myself in the mirror, I may take a REALLY quick look and that's it. This has still been the hardest part for me. I do have a few strands on each side at the sideburn area. I can't wait for it to grow in long enough not to wear a wig and start coloring it again. I found out today that my red cells were down so they gave me some shot. I missed 4 days of work last week because I felt so awful and out of energy, not that I had that much energy to begin with, but tkaes everything I have just to walk upstairs and down.
Posts.Title: growing hair back
FIRST CHEMO TREATMENT/PORT

Posts.Content: Let me try to describe this the best I can. I am having almost like post nasal drip into my throat, but I know it's not that because this just started since I started chemo. I can be sitting here and all of a sudden it's like a few drops of (I don't know what) saliva, maybe nasal drip?? drips down and like almost chokes me. I start coughing real hard for just 3-4 times, but it's an awful feeling. And it's not constant. It just happens all of a sudden with no warning. I always feel like I have a small lump in my throat anyway since doing chemo.
Posts.Title: What is this?

Posts.Content: My prayers are with her.
Posts.Title: Hi Girls, Needing your special prayers...

Posts.Content: I'm confused with the Taxol. What is that? Is that something they added to your chemo? I forgot what I'm getting. It's written down somewhere. I lost my nose hairs too. No armpit hair, no hair below my knees, but yet I have this lot of hair that I have alwyas had on the back of my thighs, it's still there!!! The place I would love to lose it. And of course down below.
Posts.Title: Losing eyelashes again

Posts.Content: Welcome to the board Carol, but sorry you had to come over here. These ladies have a lot of advice and info. I just had my 2nd chemo last Thursday. As some of the ladies here have said in other posts, "it's the unknown" that is the scariest. My hair came out real bad 14 days after my 1st treatment. I think everyone here who has had chemo will tell you that has been the worst part. I still have some patches here and there on my head. Just haven't gone anywhere to have it shaved and scared to do it myself, I may end up looking like a badly carved pumpkin!
Posts.Title: Newbie to BC, and this board

Posts.Content: Do whatever you need to do to find out what it is. My surgeon tld me last week that she had a lot of women in their 30's this year with breast csncer.

Posts.Title: I still hurt

Posts.Content: Please be safe whoever may be in the path.
Posts.Title: Hurricane Rita

Posts.Content: I had 1st treament on 9/15. I was a little tired and kind of woosy feeling over the weekend, but never really felt sick. My mouth is so dry and I want to keep eating just to have a different taste in my mouth, which is not good because I don't need to gain any weight. I haven't really felt like vomiting, but when that little lump came up in my throat a couple of times, I just took a pill. I've had heartburn a couple of times. The warehouse manager has the flu or bad cold, so now I'm scared I'll get sick from him. I had been suffering with tennis elbow (not from playing tennis) for the last 3-4 months and that has just disappeared over the weekend. Maybe a reverse reaction to the Neulasta shot or the chemo drugs. I got the drugs thru the same arm the tennis elbow was in. I mean I feel no pain at all in. I was having problems picking things up certain ways because it was hurting so bad. Anyway, I guess for the most part, I'm doing ok so far. I just had a piece of chocolate cake, yummy!!
Posts.Title: My weekend after chemo

Posts.Content: I can't help but laugh at the way you told your story. I'm so sorry you have to go through all this.
Posts.Title: Clutter Alert

Posts.Content:
Well, I have not been feeling to well for the last 3 days. 
 My stomach is hurting so bad, I think I got constipated again, so I have been taking laxatives (1 each day) I stayed home today because I felt kind of flu-ish this morning. I took a hot bath then started to feel a teensy bit better than ate a hamburger for lunch and I think that did me in. I have been in pain all day with my stomach and I can only think that I am full of crap. Since the weekend I have been just eating anything because I can't stand this this dry yucky feeling in my mouth and food just seems to make it feel a little better. I talked to a nurse today about
 the flu like symptoms and she said I may be coming down with a bug and to come in tomorrow at noon to check my blood. I'm supposed to gon on Monday. My throat has been kind of sore. I spoke to someone at work today and  guy that has been out for 2 days came in today and he is real sick, I thought, great. I have this weird pain in my throat. I will see how I feel lin the morning.
Posts.Title: My weekend after chemo

Posts.Content:
Well, it almost seems like it was coming up my throat. It's better now. I noticed to I don't have any nose hairs! 
   I don't remember what my cocktail is. I had a visit with the Onc yesterday and she said something about
 one of the drugs making it seem like or bring on allergies. I don't have any allergies that I know of prior to all of this. I have noticed my nse being runnier the last few days, but I'm not sure if I may be coming down with a cold or not. I would only cough though when the saliva or whatever it may be would hit that little thingy that hangs down in the back of your throat. Just think, I get to do it all again next Wednesday!
Posts.Title: What is this?
Chemo Options
Brachytherapy

Posts.Content:
I didn't want to start a new topic on this since today was my 1st day. It went fine. I took a portable CD player with me and a puzzle book. Whatever that red crap med is that they put in me with a syringe, I could feel it going through my vein, it was cool feeling. I got home about
 5:30 had a bagel and some chicken noodle soup. I don't feel sick in any way....... 
Hopefully I won't but do have some drugs for it. I may take one shortly just in case. I don't even want to get to that point. I kind of feel a little bit of a lump in my throat right now, so it may be coming. 
   So I go back on 10/6 for round 2. I've been drinking quite a bit of water since I've been home, which I really don't like water, but I will do what I can to try to take care of myself for now. Sorry you keep getting delayed with your treatment. I wish I could have delayed mine and delayed and delayed.

I got home about
 5 30 had a bagel and some

Posts.Title: Chantry, how did chemo go?

Posts.Content: In my last post I meant to say the Zoladec shot is the one I'm also getting to stop me from ovulating not the Neulasta. Chemo brain already.
Posts.Title: Chantry, how did chemo go?

Posts.Content:
An update on this. I had the balloon and catheter inserted yesterday. The catheter is taped underneath my boob. I can't feel that there is a balloon inside of me but it's just the thought that's kind of ceepy. I'm like scared to move for fear that it may pop. It's filled with saline so if it does it's not like there will be something toxic running into me. Most of it would probably run out of me anyway. And of all things a rep from the company that makes them was there to watch and help if needed, and 
 happened to be kind of cute too. I didn't have to let me they said, but when they said he traveled about
 2-2 1/2 hours to watch I figured that was the least I could do. But he was very nice and wanted to know if I wanted him to hold my hand. I didn't really feel anything because they numbed my boob. But I just had surgery again on the 27th to take out 3 nodes (which were negative,yay) so I'm still recooperating from that pain. The pain under my arm from that is what has been the worst. I go for a catscan this morning to make sure the balloon is in the proper place and should start radiation on Monday 2 times a day but only for 5 days. Hopefully, I won't have any real side effects since it will be short term.
Posts.Title: Brachytherapy
Brachytherapy
Brachytherapy

Posts.Content: I'm not really sure what the Neulasta is for other than it stops you from ovulating. I have only taken 1 nausea pill everyday except today. I only take when I get that small lump like feeling in my throat like I may throw up in a while. So I'm only taking as I feel I may need it. I feel a little tired, but ok in general.
Posts.Title: Chantry, how did chemo go?

Posts.Content:
Well, it's day 2 after my chemo. So far I am doing ok other than some heartburn. I took some Peptol Bismol (tablet) and it relieved it some. about
 8:45 the 1st night I felt a small lump in my throat like maybe I may feel ill so I took 1 of the pills for nausea and went to bed. I got that way about
 10:30 last night too so I took another one. My mouth is extremely dry. I have drank more water in the last 2 days that I probably have in the last 2 months. I don't like to drink water even though I know it's good for you because it makes my stomach hurt if I drink too much, but hasn't seemed to bother me yet. I got my Neulasta shot yesterday and I took a prescript
ion motrin before I went to bed last night in case I may wake up with any joint pain. I felt a little jittery yesterday morning and I don't know if it was just anxiety that I may get sick or if it's that pill I have to take for 4 mornings after treatment.
Posts.Title: Chantry, how did chemo go?

Posts.Content: Glad you're 1st session went well. It's not really bad, like everyone says, it's the unknowning. How many treatments are you getting? I am getting 6.

 20 years ago.

I too was having a problem finding a wig to match my (dyed) color which is a kind of burgundy. I have not started chemo yet but am trying to be way ahead of the game. I went to a specialty shop that has different things for breast cancer patients. There is not much in the color I want. I found one that is kind of close to my haircut. I'm not crazy about

Posts.Content: I know I mentioned this treatemt hoping that I will be a candidate for it in my "newbie" topic, but has anyone here done this radaition treatment?
Posts.Title: Brachytherapy

Posts.Content:
Just wanted to let you all know, that I had my 2nd surgery Wednesday and I will be a candidate for this radiation treatment. I go next Friday for an xray or something so they can size me up or whatever. I can't remember half of what they tell me anymore. I'm still so overwhelmed by all of this. I'm still kind of feelin the effects of the anesthesia today. Blechhhhh! Here's a little something about
 it. I'll keep you updated once it starts and how it goes.
MammoSite Radiation Therapy System (RTS), FDA-approved in May 2002, is a simpler, less invasive method of delivering breast brachytherapy, a site-specific radiation treatment completed in four to five days, as compared to seven weeks for traditional external beam radiation therapy. The new device delivers radiation directly to the area where a breast tumor has been surgically removed via lumpectomy, which is the site where tumors are most likely to recur. With its site-specific approach, MammoSite avoids external beam therapy side effects, such as the irradiation of healthy tissue.
Brachytherapy is the first breast cancer treatment to deliver radiation directly to the original tumor site and decrease radiation time. While standard breast brachytherapy involves surgically implanting up to 24 catheters into the breast, MammoSite calls for just a single catheter to perform the therapy.
MammoSite RTS consists of a balloon catheter that is inserted into the area of the breast where the tumor was removed. Once inserted, the balloon is expanded and radiation is delivered through a tiny bead attached to a wire, irradiating the area surrounding the cavity.

Posts.Title: First Chemo treatment
new to breast cancer

Posts.Content:
Yay! I finished my rads today. They took out the balloon and I barely felt anything. I had all this anxiety all afternoon about
 more pain. I had surgery on 7/27, a week later they made an additional teeny incision where I was already cut for this balloon. So I have been having pain one way or another for the last 2 weeks. I can finally take a shower. This bird bath bathing doesn't quite cut it. Then...because this thing would drain, I was wearing a maxi pad under it to catch any drainage and on top of that I started draining from the other end (if you know what I mean) So I have been wearing pads in 2 places for the last week. Anyway, that part is over.

Posts.Content:
I went back to the surgeon's offcie today and I remebered the name of the radiation after you said it Skeeter. She said that it now has a permanent code (insurance purposes?) because it is a successful treatment. I go back for surgery again on the 27th to make sure there is no more cancer there and also to do a sentinal node biopsy. I'm a good candidate for the Brachytherapy but they won't know for sure until the slice me 
open again. This is all taking so long since I 1st found the lump. I would much rather do the Brachytherapy. It will be less expensive on my wallet. For the traditional radiation I have to pay a copayment each time I go ($25 each visit,5 dyas a week for 6 weeks I think). I will be in the poorhouse by the time they would finish! All of this is stressing me out between getting referrals from my primary care, calling the ins co to make sure this and that is covered to having to tell my mom when she comes back on Saturday and my job!

Posts.Title: Yea! One More Year

Posts.Content:
My surgeon didn't think I should have to either, so I called my ins co again tomake sure and told them it's like part of the package. That I would not actually be seeing the doctor each time and they said yes I have to pay the co pay each time. That's why I'm more interested in doing the Brachytherapy. I got a copy of my Pathology report, I guess my cancer type is "carcinoma"?? They call it a garden variety type which is supposed to be a better cancer?? In my opnion, no cancer is good. 
Anyone here who has gone thru chemo and has had the hair loss, did you lose any body hair too? Eyebrows, arm hair, eyelashes etc..? I have been so stressed this week between all this info, trying to get referrals from my primary care doc's office, my job and having to tell my mom (who comes back today) that my period is later than last month. No, I'm not pregnant. I had my tubes tied years ago. Wish me luck with my mom today. She is going to be devastated. She's going to think just like I did when I heard the word cancer, "death sentence". I called the American Cancer Society and they are sending me some stuff on different things and also had the names of some wig shops in my area. Yes, I am more worried about
 my hair than anything else, and that this is going to interfere with my vacation in Spetember.
Thanks again for everyone's help/support and hugs to everyone here.
